item.title: Wuthering Waves - Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket: Ragunna Locations
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #1
  • Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #2

Located in the center of Rinascita, Nimbus Sanctum is an ethereal landscape covered in shiny clouds and chilling mist. Its vast terrain is mountainous and surrounded by rivers dyed in sunset gold. Wuthering Waves players probably familiarize the region with one of Rinascita’s iconic world bosses - Lorelei.

Aside from the numerous puzzles, scary enemies, and treacherous waters that make up Nimbus Sanctum, Wuthering Waves players can also find Sonance Caskets in the area. Some of them are hard to find and require a trek, whilst the rest are pretty straightforward. What’s more is that WuWa players can collect all nine Sonance Caskets across the region and exchange them for Astrites.

Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #1

Teleport to the Resonance Beacon south of Polyphemos Windmills and glide southeast into Mistveil Bay . This Sonance Casket will be on a pillar near the pink tree.

Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #2

From the previous location, head right towards the gondola platform to find Sonance Casket No. 2 under the roof.

Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #3

This Sonance Casket is closer to the Resonance Nexus in the area. Once you teleport there, turn around and look up in front of you. The Sonance Casket will be on a broken bridge, and you can only reach it by running across the shore and taking a short swim to the broken archways. You’ll pass some enemies along the way, so remember to be careful as you make your way across.

Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #4

This next Sonance Casket is south of Nimbus Sanctum , but it’s much easier to teleport to the Resonance Nexus at Thessaleo Falls and head north from there . You need to head up the cliff in front of you and then fly off of it in order to find the Sonance Casket right beneath it. It will be between two pillars.

Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #5

Teleport to the Resonance Beacon inside the Garden of the Lost and turn around to head outside the cave. Keep going left until you reach the mist/cloud covered golden river. The Sonance Casket will be in the air to your right. WuWa players should keep in mind that, though this Sonance Casket seems to be located near Averardo Vault, it actually falls under the Nimbus Sanctum region.

Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #6

Next, teleport back to the Nimbus Sanctum Resonance Nexus and head straight up the stairs in front of you. Go left, pass all the enemies, and keep an eye out for a set of rocks stacked over each other . Take an immediate left , and you’ll spot the Sonance Casket hidden behind some rubble.

Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #7

Teleport back to the Resonance Nexus once again, head up the stairs, and grab a ride from the Wingray to your left . Let it carry you all the way up, and you’ll spot the Sonance Casket to your left.

Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #8

This Sonance Casket in the region is located southeast from where you currently are . Quite frankly, you can easily fly to the area, and all you need to do is find the broken building. Keep flying left until you reach this massive broken bridge , and right below it is the building with the Sonance Casket inside it.

Nimbus Sanctum Sonance Casket Location #9

The final Sonance Casket will actually be above you, on the opposite side of the massive broken bridge. You need to equip your flying gear and head up into the air to see it clearly. It will be located at the very southeast of the Lorelei Boss Arena on the bridge that divides the Atrium of Reflections from the Garden of the Lost .

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - How To Advance Time
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Wait In Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2
  • Other Ways To Advance Time In Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

One of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 's most important features is time, as it's very possible to miss deadlines for quests and miss content simply because you slept through it or weren't there when someone asked you to be. While you'll always want to make the most of your time, sometimes you'll want to progress time to another day or set hour.

There are multiple ways of progressing time outside of the obvious answer of just playing the game. Here are all the ways you can progress time and how to do them in-game.

How To Wait In Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Skipping Time can be done anywhere as long as you're not currently in combat, in a dangerous location, or in the middle of a story mission that needs to be completed right then. To do so, just open up the wait menu:

  • Touch Pad on the PlayStation
  • T on Keyboard
  • View on Xbox

This menu will be a 24-hour wheel showing you when the sun rises and sets, along with what time it currently is. You can choose to wait for as many hours as you'd like but just be warned that waiting greatly drains your exhaustion and hunger .

This menu can also be used to check what time it is whenever needed as you can see the time and close the menu without actually waiting.

Other Ways To Advance Time In Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

While waiting seems to be the easiest way of advancing time, you can also advance time by fast traveling and sleeping . Sleeping is by far the best method as long as you have somewhere to sleep. Sleeping lets you also save the game for free while also restoring your exhaustion and your hunger will be reduced at a much slower rate than rating.

Fast Traveling will also advance time and while you fast travel a small wheel will appear and show you how much time is passing while you fast travel. That being said, there's no way to decide how long you fast travel for or how long the trip will take . This is a very unreliable method, and should almost never be used to advance time. Outside of those methods you're only other option is to stand around and wait for whatever you want to happen, but at that point, you should use the wait feature as it will cause more exhaustion and hunger but save you more real-world time.

item.title: Fisch: How To Find And Use Sunken Chests
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Find Sunken Chests In Fisch
  • How To Use Sunken Chests In Fisch
    • All Sunken Chest Rewards In Fisch

In Roblox 's Fisch , players need access to plenty of unique things in order to snag valuable fish, including totems, baits, powerful rods, and even a speedy boat. While most of these cost a lot of in-game money, there are ways to get them for free—like Sunken Chests.

The Sunken Treasure event is a server hunt that happens every hour, allowing players to grab different rewards by opening Sunken Chests. For those looking to make the most of this event, here's how to find and open the Sunken Chests in Fisch .

How To Find Sunken Chests In Fisch

Sunken Chests can be found by sailing to the server-announced area in Fisch . These treasure boxes spawn near random islands on the map, and all players receive a notification about their location on the screen. To reach them, simply hop on a boat and get there quickly. Sunken Chests will be floating on wooden planks in the ocean near the mentioned area.

Keep in mind that you have a total of 10 minutes to collect these chests, but they can only be claimed by one person , so you have to hurry. If nobody collects them, they'll disappear. However, this rarely happens on public servers, as players compete to grab the free items inside (you can also join private servers to increase your chances of getting them). Sunken Chests often spawn near Roslit Bay, Moosewood, and Forsaken Shores, but the location is always unpredictable. You can't summon them using Sundial Totems, so make sure to check every 60 minutes.

How To Use Sunken Chests In Fisch

As mentioned earlier, Sunken Chests can be used to obtain valuable rewards. Once you find them in the ocean, simply jump out of your boat, approach them, and press the E icon . Do this for every treasure chest available there.

Usually, you'll spot between three and five chests per event . That said, there are two rarities of Sunken Chests: Ordinary and Mythical . Ordinary ones have golden skin, while Mythical ones have purple skin. Like other hunts, the rarity is not announced to players; you will only know which type of chests are present once you get to the location.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - How To Start the Lion's Crest DLC quest
item.description:
Now that Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has been released, there are many burning questions that can be answered. This long-awaited sequel seems to improve upon many of its predecessor’s flaws while implementing a few things of its own that make it very interesting.

A quest that seems to be causing a lot of confusion among players is that of the Lion’s Crest, as it’s not entirely clear where players must go to start it or how they can go about completing it. Here’s how to start the Lion’s Crest DLC quest in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , so you can get Sir Brunswick’s armor.

How To Start The Lion's Crest DLC Quest

Once you’ve managed to start the Lion’s Crest DLC quest, you'll probably think that it wasn't that complicated to begin with, but since there's little to no indication of the starting point, confusion is understandable. First, you'll have to have progressed through the opening of a game up to the point where you're free to explore the township of Troskowitz. A good indication that you’ve reached this point, is being able to start the “Wedding Crashers” quest . Provided you’re already at that point in the game, you can start looking for the Lion’s Crest quest’s starting point.

If you check your map, you'll see an indicator in Troskowitz with a DLC quest marker on it. Following it will lead you to the area’s scribe, who goes by the name of Gaibl. It should be noted that you'll need a spade to progress through this mission, so make sure that you already have one before starting the Lion’s Crest DLC quest. Talk to Gaibl, and he’ll tell you a story, as well as a riddle that you’ll have to solve to move forward.

What's The Answer To The First Riddle?

Rather than relying on further map indicators to help you reach your destination, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 opts to let you solve Gaibl’s riddle. Look closely at the buildings in Troskowitz, and you’ll slowly start to find the answers you’re looking for.

  • When the riddle mentions “the crone and maiden”, it refers to the towers in Trosky Castle, which are, conveniently, named the same.
  • When “true midnight” is referenced, it means that you must go north, as it alludes to the position of the number 12 on a clock.
  • After heading north for a while, you’ll come across a rock formation that has a gap in between to let you through. This is what the “two guards of stone” refers to.
  • Finally, you’ll find a chapel in a cave. Inside, you’ll see a stone cross. Interacting with it will allow you to start digging and find the first piece of the Brunswick Armour.

Finding all the pieces will take you a while, but once you complete the set, you’ll quickly discover that it was well worth the effort. If you need a little extra help with money, teleportation, or even getting Saviour Schnapps, you can always turn to Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 's console commands.

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth: Tifa's Best Knuckles Weapon Skills, Ranked
item.description:
Monk is one of the most common Jobs in Square Enix's Final Fantasy series. It was present in the first game on the NES, and it appears in Final Fantasy 14 , the latest MMO-based entry that is still going strong today. For Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , Tifa served as the Monk-equivalent of the group.

The same is true for Tifa in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , except it feels a lot better to control her manually instead of through turn-based combat. Players can practically feel her fists pummel foes thanks to the PS5’s vibration functionality. All of Tifa’s gloves in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth come attached with weapon skills. These are some of the best to equip in the game to make her even stronger.

Updated On February 5th, 2025: Tifa is one of the strongest party members in the game, dealing a ton of damage and also excelling at staggering enemies. A lot of her play style revolves around the ability Unbridled Strength, and there are multiple useful skills to make this ability even more useful. This list has been updated to include additional skills, multiple of which specifically benefit Unbridled Strength and help push an already strong party member even further. There have also been additional weapons listed for many skills to show other options when trying to choose which weapons and skills you want to choose.

10 Selfish Buff Up

Buff Yourself For Longer Benefits

  • Weapon: Tiger Fangs

Tifa is a melee-focused character who should just about always be focused on dealing damage above healing and supporting. That being said, giving her one buff Materia along with the Selfish Buff Up skill can help make her much more deadly, especially if it's an Attack boosting buff.

Selfish Buff Up increases the duration of a buff on herself by 25%, letting her get more out of buffing herself instead of being buffed by another character. Tifa also generates ATB at incredible speeds, so using one to buff herself every now and then won't lessen her damage output at all, and actually increase it.

9 Max HP +200

Everyone Needs More Health

  • Weapons: Leather Gloves & Tiger Fangs

The Leather Gloves are Tifa’s default weapon in the game. They will grant her a bevy of weapon skills like Max HP +200, which will give her a health boost once equipped. There are a lot of ways to increase HP in the game and most weapons for Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth’s playable cast have this weapon skill on at least one armament.

Another good way to increase HP in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth is through the Complete Materia, HP UP. It will increase HP through percentages and get better over time. Players may also want to invest time into MP Up, which will obviously increase MP, the lifeblood of magic users.

8 Opening ATB Bonus

Start Battles Right

  • Weapon: Crystal Gloves

The Crystal Gloves is a later-game weapon for Tifa as they can be obtained in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth’s Nibel region. Players can equip the Opening ATB Bonus with these gloves, which will start Tifa out with a little of her ATB gauge filled. Players can attack enemies with normal attacks non-stop.

To use special abilities or magic though, players need an ATB charge or two. It will fill automatically with time or by hitting enemies. First Strike is another great Complete Materia that can help Tifa as it will fill the ATB gauge at the start of a battle, just like Opening ATB Bonus.

7 Enhanced Elements

Knock ‘Em Out With A Fire Punch

  • Weapon: Crystal Gloves

The Crystal Gloves have another good weapon skill for players to put to the test. Enhanced Elements will increase elemental damage done with Tifa’s gloves, which is a two-step process. To make the most of this weapon skill, players should first equip the Support Materia, Elemental, which is a notable one in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth .

Players can link a Magic Materia like Fire onto the Elemental Materia, imbuing Tifa’s gloves with fire-based damage. She also gains resistance to fire in this state. Enhanced Elements then will make that Elemental link-up a lot stronger, which is good to keep in mind for tough bosses in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth .

6 Limit Break Damage +10%

Do A Somersault

  • Weapons: Crystal Gloves & Jarngreipr

The Crystal Gloves are here again to increase Tifa’s Limit Break power instead. With the Limit Break Damage +10% weapon skill, players can do more damage using Tifa’s two initial Limit Breaks. The first one is called Somersault, and it’s the same type of attack from the original game on PS1.

Her other attack, Dolphin Flurry, is a reworked move, and it used to be called Dolphin Blow in the original game. Both are strong attacks, but Dolphin Flurry can significantly Stagger enemies in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . In Staggered states, enemies take on more damage while being paralyzed.

5 Attack Damage +5%

A Standard Buff For Your Fisticuffs

  • Weapon: Leather Gloves & Sylph Gloves

The Leather Gloves and Sylph Gloves return for one of the most basic boosts players can get in an RPG. Attack Damage +5% will increase Tifa’s normal attacks, and while that might sound boring, her punches are going to be what players use the most. Again, normal attacks are the easiest way to build up the ATB gauge.

Tifa excels at speeding around battle arenas, punching foes, and dodging attacks like a master. She may not be able to punch through thick skin or armor as easily as Cloud’s iconic Buster Sword, but Tifa still does well in battle. She’s up there as one of the best playable characters in the game.

4 Enhanced Techniques

Triangle-Based Tactics

  • Weapon: Sylph Gloves

Every character in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth has a special attack mapped to the Triangle button. A character like Barret, for example, has an ability called Overcharge that launches a charged blast at opponents. Tifa has three martial arts moves, but using them all in battle requires a bit of finesse.

Her normal special is called Whirling Uppercut; furthermore, if players charge her Chi levels twice using Unbridled Strength, she can also use Omnistrike along with Rise and Fall. Now, the Sylph Gloves, which can be obtained in the Mythril Mine, has a weapon skill attached to it called Enhanced Techniques. This weapon skill will boost Tifa’s unique abilities by 15%, making Whirling Uppercut, Omnistrike, and Rise and Fall stronger.

3 Martial Arts Mastery

Longer Unbridled Strength

  • Weapons : Leather Gloves & Kaiser Knuckles

Martial Arts Masters expends the duration of Unbridled Strength by 50%, making it last much longer and saving you more ATB every fight to use on other abilities and take advantage of the damage and stagger buffs during its effects. Unbridled Strength is the backbone of playing as Tifa, and this Skill simply makes it easier to manage.

While this upgrade is just an extension of how long it lasts, anything that upgrades Unbridled Strength in any way is a necessity. This skill can also be combined with the next to make her much stronger when you use the Leather Gloves.

2 Utterly Unbridled Strength

Makes Unbridled Strength Even Stronger

  • Weapons: Tiger Fangs, Jarngreipr, & Leather Gloves

Unbridled Strength is arguably Tifa's best ability since it makes her basic attacks deal more damage and can stagger enemies even faster than usual. This skill boosts that damage even further, while also increasing the damage boost with each level of Chi she reaches during battle.

Using Unbridled Strength increases Tifa's Stagger multiplier, and should be her main focus in any battle. Since Unbridled Strength should always be active while she's in a fight, it makes sense that one of her best skills makes that ability even stronger.

1 Concentration

Hone In On Tifa's Inner Monk

  • Weapon: Kaiser Knuckles

Unbridled Strength will not only charge Tifa’s Chi levels, but it will also increase her normal attack power. It should be a go-to ability for players to use in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . Players can begin battles with Unbridled Strength activated if they have the Kaiser Knuckles.

The Kaiser Knuckles can be obtained on the Shinra-8 cruise liner, and they will give players the option to equip Concentration to Tifa. Concentration gives them a 50% chance to start a battle with Unbridled Strength activated and that would be a great benefit for multiple reasons.
